p: Prolonged viral shedding, a common occurrence with other respiratory viruses, is likely in HCT recipients. Separate areas in outpatient settings for potential infectious and noninfectious individuals should be available, with checkpoints at the entrance.Â Patients with confirmed COVID-19 infection should be tested regularly (depending on the institutional policies and/or governmental regulations) until the RT-PCR results turn negative. Until then, these patients should be considered potentially infectious. Other important issues to address include social distancing and mask wearing in the waiting area, direct rooming (ie, no waiting), barring of visitors from the outpatient area, and avoidance of common areas (including cafeteria).
